heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 26 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (223°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and feels like temperature (up 2.9°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 5%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 362 m).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 362.1m higher than yesterday, 316.2m higher than the past week, 60.9m higher than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 604m and a peak of 2320m, averaging 1413.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
